column3: **This sheet has only those fields which are not already listed in the Condition Assessment Tab
column7: Old Term replaced by AB or MK

column3: Definitions
The disturbance has been observed before, but is no longer present.
The disturbance has been observed before and is not getting worse or better.
The disturbance is new, and has not been observed before.
The disturbance has been observed before and is increasing (getting worse).
The disturbance has been observed before and is decreasing (getting better), for example because actions have taken place to improve it.
It is not known whether the disturbance is new, stable, decreasing or increasing, for example because the heritage feature is observed for the first time.
Definitions
Unknown
Definitions
The construction material is the reason why the threat exists.
Excavation on or nearby the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.
Flammable or combustible material on or next to the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.

column1: Lack of Access to the Site
column3: Lack of access to the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of an evacuation plan from the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of fencing around the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of a fire alarm on the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of a fire extinguisher on the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.

column1: Lack of Local and Traditional Knowledge
column3: A lack of local or traditional knowledge is the reason why the recorded threat(s) to the heritage feature exist(s).
column7: عدم وجود معرفة تقليدية أو محلية

column3: A lack of maintenance is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of regular monitoring is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of roofing is the reason why the threat exists.
A lack of security is the reason why the threat exists.
The location of the heritage feature is a direct reason for the threat.
A reason not listed here is the reason why the threat exists.
Poor design and construction are the reasons why the threat exists.
Poor drainage of the area is the reason why the threat exists.
Previous interventions or restorations have created the threat.
Bad site management is the reason for the threat.

column1: Use of Incompatible Materials for Repair
column3: The use of incompatible materials for previous repair is the reason why the threat exists.
The wiring or electricity supply to the heritage feature is the reason why the threat exists.
